aims: This subject will explore the design of various electrical and electronic systems and provide students with a range of common and practical design techniques and circuits in the context of a guided laboratory based project.
indicative content: Subject may cover specific concepts surrounding the design and implementation of:
Base-band signalling schemes and clock recovery;
Batteries, battery charging systems, and management;

assessments.description: One written examination. Intended Learning Outcomes (ILOs) 1-4 are addressed in this assessment.. 3 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Students must score above a hurdle requirement on the total of oral assessment, individual project assignment and final exam. The hurdle requirement will be set by the Board of Examiners and be no higher than 50%
Continuous assessment of submitted individual project report including initial circuit design and simulation. ILO 2 is addressed in this assessment.. 8-10 hours (of work required)

Continuous assessment of submitted individual assignment. ILOs 1, 2, 4 are addressed in this assessment.. 18-20 hours (of work required). Hurdle requirement:. Students must score above a hurdle requirement on the total of oral assessment, individual project assignment and final exam. The hurdle requirement will be set by the Board of Examiners and be no higher than 50%

Continuous assessment of submitted group project work (2-3 students) including innovation in hardware or software implementation. Approximately 5 hours of work per student. ILOs 1, 4 are addressed in this assessment.. 5 hours (of work required)

Oral assessment of hardware implementation and demonstration of project. Approximately 20-25 hours of work per student. ILOs 2, 3, 4 are addressed in this assessment.. 20-25 hours (of work required). Hurdle requirement:. Students must score above a hurdle requirement on the total of oral assessment, individual project assignment and final exam. The hurdle requirement will be set by the Board of Examiners and be no higher than 50%

Semester 2.Contact hours: 2 x one hour lectures and 1 x three hour workshop per week

Recommended texts and other resources: P. Horowitz & W. Hill,The Art of Electronics, Cambridge University Press
Additional recommended texts will be outlined throughout the lecture notes.

Subject notes: Credit may not be obtained for both:
ELEN40013 (431-481) Electronic Circuit Design 3 and ELEN90053 Electronic System Design
The subject is delivered through lectures and workshop classes that combine both tutorial and hands-on laboratory activities.
Students are provided with lecture slides, worked problem sets, project specifications, and reference text lists.

The subject prepares students towards careers in electronic engineering, product design, and instrumentation engineering roles and will provide the relevant exposure to industry standard engineering design tools through laboratory activities.
Relevant Societies for Career and Professional Development:
IEEE (including Electron Devices Society, Circuits and Systems Society)
